Speaker.hpid: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond) Barry Desmond
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond)
Speaker.P: The unemployment assistance claim of the person concerned has been put into payment on the basis of a qualification certificate issued to him in connection with a previous claim which recorded him as having nil means. He is accordingly in receipt of £72.25 weekly the appropriate rate in his case. All arrears due were paid on 20 June 1985 less an amount in respect of supplementary welfare allowance paid to him pending authorisation of his claim.

Speaker.hpid: Dr. McCarthy Dr. McCarthy
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Social Welfare the reason a free electricity allowance has not been granted to a person (details supplied) in County Tipperary and if this decision will be reviewed.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond) Barry Desmond
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond)
Speaker.P: To be eligible for a free electricity allowance a person must either be living alone or be living with certain categories of persons only. A free electricity allowance cannot be granted to the person concerned as his brother resides with him who is not a person who comes within these categories for satisfying the living alone condition of the scheme.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Social Welfare when a decision will be made on the application for an old age pension made by a person (details supplied) in County Galway.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond) Barry Desmond
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond)
Speaker.P: It has been decided that the person concerned is not entitled to an old age pension as he does not fulfil the statutory condition as to means. The assessment of his means consisting of the weekly value of capital exceed the statutory limit for entitlement to pension. An appeal has been lodged against this decision and the case has been referred to an appeals officer for determination. The person concerned will be notified of the outcome in due course.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. O'Leary Mr. J. O'Leary
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Social Welfare the reason for the long delay in granting an invalidity pension to a person (details supplied) in County Kerry; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond) Barry Desmond
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond)
Speaker.P: Invalidity pension is payable in place of disability benefit to insured persons who satisfy the contribution conditions and who are permanently incapable of work.

The person concerned has been in receipt of disability benefit since 27 July 1983 and payment is being made at regular weekly intervals. The medical referee who examined the person concerned on 28 February 1985 expressed the opinion that she was not permanently incapable of work and requested that she be referred for a further examination after six months. On receipt of further medical evidence the medical adviser of the Department confirmed the opinion of the medical adviser and recommended that she be referred for an examination again. Arrangements are now being made for this examination after which her entitlement to invalidity pension will be reviewed.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. O'Leary Mr. J. O'Leary
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Social Welfare if he will arrange to have the appeal of a person (details supplied) in County Kerry against the decision to discontinue payment of his unemployment assistance specially reconsidered in view of his poor financial circumstances; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond) Barry Desmond
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond)
Speaker.P: Following reinvestigation the unemployment assistance claim of the person concerned was disallowed on the grounds that his means derived from the profit from his holding exceeded the maximum rate of unemployment assistance payable to him. He appealed against the amount of means assessed against him but on 10 April 1985 an appeals officer also assessed him with means exceeding the maximum rate payable to him. In the absence of fresh evidence or new facts the decision of an appeals officer is final.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Agriculture (Mr. Deasy) Austin Deasy
Speaker.P: The participation of the person named in the dairy herd conversion scheme will end in November 1985 and he will be paid the final instalment of £4,242.98 then.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. O'Leary Mr. J. O'Leary
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Agriculture the reason a milk quota cannot be allocated to persons (details supplied) in County Kerry in substitution for 12,000 gallons which they supplied last year to a Dutch manufacturer of cheese who is now gone out of business; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Agriculture (Mr. Deasy) Austin Deasy
Speaker.P: The full details of this case have only recently come to the Department's notice and the matter is currently being investigated with a view of deciding whether it is possible under the super-levy regulations to allocate milk quotas to the two persons concerned on the basis of the deliveries referred to. A decision on this will be taken at a very early date.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. O'Leary Mr. J. O'Leary
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Agriculture if he will arrange to pay three-quarters of the farm buildings scheme grant, under the farm modernisation scheme, to a person (details supplied) in County Kerry; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Agriculture (Mr. Deasy) Austin Deasy
Speaker.P: The person mentioned received approval under the farm modernisation scheme on 23 August 1982 for the construction of a silage slab, effluent tank, fence and gate. The procedure is that the grant becomes payable on satisfactory completion of all of the items on the approval document and it is not, therefore, possible to pay a partial grant on completion of some of the items. In any event there could be no question of paying a grant for a silage slab without appropriate provision being made for the effluent. As the applicant will have completed the maximum period of six years in the other high category on 23 July 1985 the work must be completed to specification by that date in order to qualify for the rate of grant appropriate to the other high category.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Agriculture (Mr. Deasy) Austin Deasy

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Agriculture (Mr. Deasy) Austin Deasy

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Saoráidí Iarbhunoideachais ar na hOileáin Ghaeltachta.
MainHeading.P: 183. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: den Aire Oideachais an bhfuil sí are eolas aici go bhfuil deacrachtaí móra ag páistí ar chuid de na hoileáin Ghaeltachta lántairbhe a bhaint as cúrsaí oideachais den dara leibhéal; agus an inseoidh sí céard atá leagtha amach aici leis an scéal a fheabhsú.

Speaker.hpid: An tAire Oideachais (Mrs. Hussey) An tAire Oideachais (Mrs. Hussey)
Speaker.P: Soláthraítear saoráidí iarbhunoideachais i ngach ceantar Gaeltachta ach líon sásúil daltaí a bheith ar fáil le haghaidh na saoráidí sin. Mar is eol duit, tá scoil iarbhunoideachais ar fáil ar Inis Mór agus le déanaí thug mé cead do Choiste Ghairmoideachais, Contae Dhún na nGall, scoil iarbhunoideachais a chur ar fáil ar Oileán Árainn Mhór.
Fuarthas iarratas le déanaí aitheantas a thabhairt do mheánscoil atá beartaithe ag Comhar Caomhán Teoranta a bhunú ar Inis Oirr. Tá an t-iarratas seo faoi scrúdú i mo Roinn i láthair na huaire.
Is féidir le daltaí os na hoileáin Ghaeltachta deontais aíochta a fháil ó mo Roinn chun freastal ar scoileanna iarbhunoideachais.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Castlebar New Regional College.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if a site has been purchased for the proposed new regional college in Castlebar, County Mayo; and the amount of money available in 1985 for the school.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: A site has not yet been purchased for the proposed new regional college in Castlebar, County Mayo. My Department are pursuing actively the question of acquiring a site. Apart from consultant's fees which will arise in the architectural planning process, the provision of funds for the project will not be in question until the tender stage has been reached.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Special Education Teacher Training.

Speaker.hpid: Miss Harney Miss Harney
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the proposals she has for the training of teachers for severely and profoundly mentally handicapped children over the next ten years; and the schemes currently in progress.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: It is proposed to appoint shortly the first allocation of teachers to cater for the educational needs of the severely and profoundly mentally handicapped children for the 1985-86 school year. These teachers, who will be fully qualified national teachers, will be given a short induction period on placement. There will be ongoing monitoring during the first year of operation and the more long term training needs will be assessed in the light of the experience gained. No formal training scheme is currently in progress.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Higher Education Grant Scheme.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Gregory-Independent Mr. Gregory-Independent
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she will review the decision of the Corporation of Dublin not to give a higher education grant to a person (details supplied) in Dublin 7.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: It is understood that the person in question sat for the leaving certificate examination in 1979 and that accordingly the higher education grants scheme applicable to him is the scheme for 1979.

It is also understood that the person wrote to Dublin Corporation recently seeking a grant but that the corporation did not establish whether the academic and means test requirements of the 1979 scheme would be complied with in his case in view of the fact that the 1979 scheme contains a provision that a candidate who qualifies for a grant may defer the grant for a period exceeding two years only in exceptional circumstances. The corporation did not consider the applicant's circumstances to be exceptional and were not prepared to defer grant for the period 1979-85. If the person considers that he could qualify for a grant under the terms of the higher education grants scheme 1979 and wishes to appeal, on grounds of exceptional circumstances against the corporation's decision not to defer grant in this case, it is open to him to do so.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: I am aware of the clerical and administrative staffing position of the City of Limerick Vocational Education Committee and of the implications of that position. I arranged for an assessment of the situation to be carried out recently by an officer of my Department. His report is under active consideration at present and I hope to be in a position to convey a decision in the matter at an early date.
